ORDER re 221 Motion to Revoke as to Miguel Rodriguez-Pantojas (3): DENIED. The Court has reviewed the transcript of the detention hearing and affirms the decision of the magistrate judge. Defendant Rodriguez-Pantojas is a flight risk and did not rebut that presumption. Having a previous drug conviction for drug distribution makes him a danger to the community. He is ordered to remain detained. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 12/03/2009. (bre) (Entered: 12/03/2009)

ORDER re 239 Motion for De Novo Hearing as to Luis Padilla-Perez (2): GRANTED. The magistrate judge's order granting bail conditions is revoked. A review of the transcript of the detention hearing clearly shows that defendant Padilla is a leader of the drug trafficking organization, a person who represented the suppliers of the kilos and that he was present at meetings during which alternative methods of shipping the cocaine were discussed. As such he is a danger to the community. He will remain detained. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 12/03/2009. (brc) (Entered: 12/03/2009)

ORDER as to Wilfredo Cancel-Garcia re 291 Appeal of Magistrate Judge Decision to District Court: The Court has reviewed the transcript of defendant Cancel-Garcia's detention hearing and affirms the magistrate judge's decision denying bail, finding that defendant is a risk of flight. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 12/03/2009. (brc) (Entered: 12/03/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa:Pretrial Conference as to Gerardo Torres-Rodriguez(11) and Gerardo Negron-Barreto (12) held on 5/7/2010. Present were: AUSA Maria Dominguez and Attys. Enrique Velez and Jose Blanco. Defendants were also present in Court, assisted by Court Interpreter, Hilda Gutierrez. Government informed that only defendants Torres-Rodriguez and Negron- Barreto remain for the trial to be held on 5/10/2010. Government is prepared for trial, but in a good faith attempt to reach a resolution of the case, produced witnesses so that the defendants that wish to go to trial can meet and interview them. The Government also informed that cooperating co-defendants will testify in the trial. Finally, Government informed that it will not engage in further negotiations after tonight. Defendant counsel requested time to continue conversing with their clients in order to reach an agreement. (Court Reporter Rolayne Volpe.)(Court Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez.)Hearing set for 04:00.Hearing held at 04:15.Hearing ended at 04:30. (grf) (Entered: 05/10/2010)

ORDER re 1598 Motion for Early Termination of Probation as to Manuel Santiago- Alvarado (6): DENIED without prejudice. This is another "boiler plate" motion which the probation office usually files. The Court will no longer accept such "boiler plate" motions. Their lack of detailed information does not help the Court to decide whether to terminate a defendant's supervised release term. For another example of this "boiler plate" motion, see Case No. 10-251 64 , U.S. v. Ramon Sierra-Lopez, docket number 4493. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 03/13/2020.
